Instruction: Melt shortening in a heavy saucepan over medium heat until it reaches 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt in a large mixing bowl.
Mix in the warm water until a soft and non-sticky dough forms.
Shape the dough into twelve 3-inch diameter balls. Flatten each into 1/2-inch-thick patties with a small hole in the center of each.
Fry individually in hot shortening about 1 inch deep until they turn golden brown, around 1 to 2 minutes on each side. Place on paper towels to drain.

Nutritional value of oil for frying is based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. The exact amount may vary depending on cook time and temperature, ingredient density, and the specific type of oil used.
